update.description:
This is the first PR of Rachel Hwang's work for the path planner in Gazebo under the OPW program.

According to the [design document](#!/osrf/gazebo_design/pull-request/13/adding-path-planner-design/diff), this PR is implementing the move plugin, which is used by the path planner to move the models without caring about the kinematics.
update.title: OPW Path planner: I model move plugin/example

content.raw:
I think this logic is already in the Gazebo cmake config file. Will the following work?

~~~
set (CMAKE_CXX_FLAGS "${CMAKE_CXX_FLAGS} ${GAZEBO_CXX_FLAGS}")
~~~
content.html:
I think this logic is already in the Gazebo cmake config file. Will the following work?

set (CMAKE_CXX_FLAGS "${CMAKE_CXX_FLAGS} ${GAZEBO_CXX_FLAGS}")

pullrequest.title: OPW Path planner: I model move plugin/example

content.raw:
That is a really good idea. I just add a <goals> tag which I believe make things easier to read and leave the things cleaner to add some new parameters in the future. 


```
#!xml
<plugin name="model_move" filename="libmodel_move.so">
  <goals>
     <pose>5 5 0 0 0 0</pose>
     <pose>5 -5 0 0 0 0</pose>
     <pose>0 0 0 0 0 0</pose>
  </goals>
</plugin>
```

[Commit](https://bitbucket.org/rahwang/gazebo-opw14-path-planner/commits/21d4f2d6c3b9384d33b1e9cf993bce3db46db3a1) in Rachel's repo.
content.html:
That is a really good idea. I just add a <goals> tag which I believe make things easier to read and leave the things cleaner to add some new parameters in the future. 

<plugin name="model_move" filename="libmodel_move.so">
  <goals>
     <pose>5 5 0 0 0 0</pose>
     <pose>5 -5 0 0 0 0</pose>
     <pose>0 0 0 0 0 0</pose>
  </goals>
</plugin>

Commit in Rachel's repo.

content.raw:
The style of this file needs some work. 

1. Use `public:`, `protected:`, or `private:` for every function and variable.
1. Add doxygen documentation to each function and variable.
1. Separate source from header.
content.html:
